bug.author: bendboaz
bug.summary: utils.convert_tensor considers `device = 0` to be no device
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug description</denchmark-h>
In utils.convert_tensor, this line appears: return tensor.to(device=device, non_blocking=non_blocking) if device else tensor This means that for device = 0 (as returned from torch.cuda.current_device) no conversion is applied, which can be very confusing. I might add a PR for that tomorrow, unless people tell me there's a reason to leave that line as it is. For reproduction: import torch from ignite.utils import convert_tensor
mytens = torch.zeros(2) device = torch.cuda.current_device() converted_tens = convert_tensor(mytens, device) assert converted_tens.device == device <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.4): 1.4 Ignite Version (e.g., 0.3.0): 0.3 OS (e.g., Linux): Windows 10 How you installed Ignite (conda, pip, source): conda Python version: 3.7.6
